description: From French, from Latin officīna (“a workshop”), contracted from opificīna, from opifex (“a workman”); opus (“work”) + faciō (“to make or do”).

adjectives.description: officinal (comparative more officinal, superlative most officinal)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, rare) Used in a shop, or belonging to it.
(obsolete, pharmaceutical) Kept in stock by apothecaries; said of such drugs and medicines as may be obtained without special preparation or compounding; not magistral.
